tool.name: Chimera.uchime
tool.command: mothur_wrapper.py --cmd='chimera.uchime' ## stool.trim.unique.good.fasta ## stool.trim.unique.good.uchime.chimera ## stool.trim.unique.good.uchime.accnos ## stool.trim.unique.good.uchime.alns #if $chimealns: --result='^mothur.\S+\.logfile$:'$logfile,'^\S+\.uchime\.chimeras?$:'$out_file,'^\S+\.uchime\.accnos$:'$out_accnos,'^\S+\.uchime\.alns$:'$out_alns #else: --result='^mothur.\S+\.logfile$:'$logfile,'^\S+\.uchime\.chimeras?$:'$out_file,'^\S+\.uchime\.accnos$:'$out_accnos #end if --outputdir='$logfile.extra_files_path' --fasta=$fasta #if $template.source == 'ref': --reference=$template.reference #elif $template.source == 'hist': --reference=$template.reference #elif $template.source == 'self': --reference='self' #if float($template.abskew.__str__) > 0: --abskew=$template.abskew #end if #if $template.group.__str__ != '': --group=$template.group #end if #if $template.count.__str__ != '': --count=$template.count #end if #elif $template.source == 'names': --name=$template.name #end if #if float($minh.__str__) > 0: --minh=$minh #end if #if float($mindiv.__str__) > 0: --mindiv=$mindiv #end if #if float($xn.__str__) > 0: --xn=$xn #end if #if float($dn.__str__) > 0: --dn=$dn #end if #if float($xa.__str__) > 0: --xa=$xa #end if #if int($chunks.__str__) > 0: --chunks=$chunks #end if #if int($minchunk.__str__) > 0: --minchunk=$minchunk #end if #if len($idsmoothwindow.__str__) > 0 and int($idsmoothwindow.__str__) > 0: --idsmoothwindow=$idsmoothwindow #end if ## #if len($minsmoothid.__str__) > 0 and float($minsmoothid.__str__) > 0: ## --minsmoothid=$minsmoothid ## #end if #if int($maxp.__str__) > 0: --maxp=$maxp #end if #if int($minlen.__str__) > 0: --minlen=$minlen #end if #if int($maxlen.__str__) > 0: --maxlen=$maxlen #end if $skipgaps $skipgaps2 #if $alignment.ucl: --ucl=true #if $alignment.queryfract != "None" and len($alignment.queryfract) > 0 and 1.0 >= float($alignment.queryfract) > 0: --queryfract=$alignment.queryfract #end if #end if $dereplicate $chimealns --processors=8

param.name: fasta
param.label: fasta - Candiate Aligned Sequences

param.name: source
param.label: Select Reference Template from

param.name: reference
param.label: reference - Select an alignment database

param.name: reference
param.label: reference - Reference to align with

param.name: abskew
param.label: abskew - Abundance skew (default 1.9)
param.help: Abundance skew is: min [ abund(parent1), abund(parent2) ] / abund(query)

param.name: group
param.label: group - Sequences Name reference
param.help: use the more abundant sequences from the same sample to check the query sequence

param.name: count
param.label: count - a count_table
param.help: Generated by count.seqs. When you use a count file with group info and dereplicate=T, mothur will create a *.pick.count_table file containing seqeunces after chimeras are removed.

param.name: name
param.label: name - Sequence names

param.name: dereplicate
param.label: dereplicate - remove chimeric sequences from all groups, default=f
param.help: If parameter is false, then if one group finds the seqeunce to be chimeric, then all groups find it to be chimeric

param.name: minh
param.label: minh - mininum score to report chimera. Default 0.3
param.help: Values from 0.1 to 5 might be reasonable. Lower values increase sensitivity but may report more false positives.

param.name: mindiv
param.label: mindiv - minimum divergence ratio, default 0.5
param.help: to ignore very close chimeras, increase mindiv to 1.0 or 2.0, to increase sensitivity decrease minh to 0.1

param.name: xn
param.label: xn - weight of a no vote. Default 8.0
param.help: Decreasing this weight to around 3 or 4 may give better performance on denoised data

param.name: dn
param.label: dn - pseudo-count prior on number of no votes. Default 1.4
param.help: Reasonable values are probably in the range from 0.2 to 2.0

param.name: xa
param.label: xa - eight of an abstain vote. Default 1.0
param.help: Reasonable values might range from 0.1 to 2.0

param.name: chunks
param.label: chunks - number of chunks. Default 4.
param.help: number of chunks to extract from the query sequence when searching for parents.

param.name: minchunk
param.label: minchunk - minimum length of a chunk. Default 64.

param.name: idsmoothwindow
param.label: idsmoothwindow - the length of id smoothing window. Default 32

param.name: maxp
param.label: maxp - maximum number of candidate parents to consider. Default 2
param.help: increasing maxp gives only a very small improvement in sensivity but tends to increase the error rate quite a bit

param.name: minlen
param.label: minlen - minimum unaligned sequence length. Default 10
param.help: Applies to both query and reference sequences.

param.name: maxlen
param.label: maxlen - maximum unaligned sequence length. Defaults 10000
param.help: Applies to both query and reference sequences.

param.name: skipgaps
param.label: skipgaps - columns containing gaps do not count as diffs. Default=T
param.help: controls how gapped columns affect counting of diffs

param.name: skipgaps2
param.label: skipgaps2 - column is immediately adjacent to a column containing a gap, it is not counted as a diff. Default=T
param.help: controls how gapped columns affect counting of diffs

param.name: chimealns
param.label: chimealns - Produce a file containing multiple alignments of query sequences to parents in human readable format.
param.help: Alignments show columns with differences that support or contradict a chimeric model.

param.name: ucl
param.label: ucl - Use local-X alignments.

param.name: queryfract
param.label: queryfract - minimum fraction of the query sequence that must be covered by a local-X alignment. Default 0.5.

tool.help:
**Mothur Overview**
Mothur_, initiated by Dr. Patrick Schloss and his software development team in the Department of Microbiology and Immunology at The University of Michigan, provides bioinformatics for the microbial ecology community.
.. _Mothur: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Main_Page
**Command Documenation**
The chimera.uchime_ command reads a fasta file and reference file and outputs potentially chimeric sequences. The original uchime program was written by Robert C. Edgar and donated to the public domain, http://drive5.com/uchime
.. _chimera.uchime: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Chimera.uchime
Version 1.23.0: Upgrades tool dependency to mothur 1.33 and adds support for count (mothur 1.28) and dereplicate (mothur 1.29) options.
